noun.description: Nickel telluride, NiTe₂, an opaque reddish-white mineral which crystallizes in the trigonal system and occurs as hexagonal scales.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. From melon- (in the name of the Melonese mine, Calaveras County, California, where the first specimen of the mineral to be identified was found) + -ite.
